data.title: Ugh Lunch is slow
data.text: Well this place struggled. The food was very late made me miss class. Food quality was very poor and the assistance manager bryan lied to my group and myself many time. The GM Edward quickly fixed the problem and was very professional. But bryan and the food tainted my experience. Thanks again to Edward for helping us that day.

data.title: Great Service
data.text:
My friend had garden chicken salad with Caribbean   jerk sauce  , very fresh and tasty. As far as the wings, my  other friend had mango habanero and parmesan  garlic boneless wings and they were satisfactory. I got boneless  hot original wings . The flavor of the wings were great but texture  was tough and crunchy.Darcey , our server 
 was the best . She was very attentive  to our every need. She gave samples of the sauces. It made over all fun night with friends.

data.title: Tasty food
data.text: Went to that joint to get some post show beer and snacks, wasn't disappointed. Great menu of late night snacks, good choice of beers. Service was so so... But we got our drinks and food!

data.title: My favourite on all days
data.text: I always visit this place when I am in Bay Area, California. I was pleasantly surprised to find one in Norfolk and the rest was all about a night well spent. Awesome range of draft beer, chicken wings (boneless of course) with barbecue sauce and sports.

data.title: Worst service ever!
data.text: We can in to watch the fights with 5 people. Seated right away then nothing. 30 mins before waiter came to take a drink order. He only came back to the table twice in 3 hours. I ended up walking up to the bar to order food and get refills. Kids was super rude and had a big chip on his shoulder. Won't be back to this bdubs!

data.title: Same BW3's, Another Location
data.text: You know what you're getting with any BW3's as the food is consistent.  Staff here were slow during the NFL game - stopping by maybe every 15-20 minutes.  Server continually forgot our celery, ranch and never brought the water we asked for to balance out the beers.  Service was much worse at this location than the other half dozen BW3's I've been to.

data.title: Game Wait?
data.text: When we arrived the restaurant was full and there were a lot of "hosts" or possibly waiters/waitresses without something to do standing at the front telling everyone that they were on a "game wait" so they couldn't tell us how long we'd have to wait to be seated. While our wait for 2 people was only about 20 minutes, a lot of business walked out the door during that time. I realize this is the reason for this particular type of restaurant, but management may want to consider the amount of revenue lost from people that leave because people just sit indefinitely.

data.title: First visit- loved it
data.text:
I did not know what to expect as we do not have a BWW in my hometown. I was impressed that it was not that crowded on Friday night at 7:00pm. But not becuase it was not good. 
My son has various food allergies and it is sometimes hard to find a kids menu that he can eat off of. But BWW's was great. It is nice that the kids have about the same selections as the adults just smaller sizes. 
As for the serivce, it was A1! Could not ask for better. Kept the drinks filled and checked on us often.

data.title: It's BWW
data.text: Pretty much like any other Buffalo Wild Wings.  It's a great place to watch any sports game--screens anywhere you look.

data.title: Horrible service.   Managers and workers just standing around
data.text: Worst Buffalo Wild Wings I've been too!   We waited 10 min before anyone came over to take our drink order.   The food came but no silverware.  She had to find it.  5 min later. She came back.  Our waitress was running around dealing with several tables meanwhile the manager and 3 workers were just standing at the front.  Apparently it takes them all the seat the one group waiting.

data.title: nice sportsbar
data.text: Typical Sportsbar with lots of burgers and beers. The servers are friendly and take the time needed to explain the menu. Around 25 different flat screens to show sports like baseball, basketball, american and real football. No need to write more.

data.title: bad service and bad food
data.text: Eat in the bar area and the service was very slow and poor....The server 'never checked on us after we got our food and drinks that took forever to get....They never brought us a bill and when the manager brought us the bill it was incorrect....Will never sponsor this Buffalo Wild Wings again....

data.title: I don't get it
data.text: The atmosphere here is great for watching a football game.  I'm guessing that is why people come.  The wings are small pieces of chicken buried in a massive amount of fried goo.  The sauces are filled with sugar and nothing special. Really?

data.title: OK if you are in a hurry
data.text: We went here because it was close to Chrysler Hall and we wanted to get a quick bite before seeing the play.  Service was good, our food was so so.  I order the hamburger and buffalo chips with pickle.  The burger was pretty good but the buffalo chips were pretty soggy, almost like they were undercooked, the pickle was awful.  My wife order the 4 chicken tenders meal.  The onion rings were quite good but the chicken tenders were overcooked, they were very hard and you had to bite down carefully to make sure you did not crack a filling, She only ate one tender and I tried half of one, we left the rest.  I don't think we will go back again, unless we wanted to try their chicken wings and watch a game.

data.title: Great customer service and food !!
data.text:
For the life of me I can't remember our servers name but he was very attentive during our lunch.
The wings came out quick and hot.  The beers were ice cold !!  We basically had the place to ourselves which was fantastic.  The other staff we encountered were very friendly.
All in all we ahd a great time !!
We will be back here next time we fly in from Vegas.

Thank you BWW Norfolk !!

data.title: Tiny Slippery Wings
data.text: I stumbled upon this Buffalo Wild Wings in Norfolk while on vacation in Norfolk on a Saturday afternoon and, having heard about about Buffalo Wild Wings for months (they have several locations in the New York/Metropolitan area) decided to give it a try. As the waiter gave me a menu, he asked me if there was any game I wanted to watch. Since the Yankees were playing, I asked for the Yankee game; about a minute later, the Yankee game was on several TVs. For my meal, I ordered jalapeno chicken wings for an appetizer, a pulled pork chicken sandwich and strawberry ice cream for dessert. The pulled pork sandwich was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of barbecue sauce and the strawberry ice cream had plenty of strawberries. Ironically, the low light of the meal was the chicken wings. When the chicken wings arrived, the first thing I noticed was how small they are. The size of the chicken wings, combined withnthe sauce, made them difficult to eat; they slipped out of my hand as Intried to eat them, and one of them landed on the floor. A huge disapointment considering that the one menu item that they always hype in their commercials is their chicken wings ("The official chicken wing of the New York Yankees!). This place is great for watching sports (I enjoyed watchingnthe Yankees win) and the pulled pork is excellent but if you're just going for chicken wings, go somewhere else!

data.title: Bad customer service
data.text: Went there on a Sunday for football and wings, and was surprised by the lack of service.  The hostness were more concerned about the football game then taking our names down. Asked if we could sit outside so we could watch the game but they said they were all full up. Looking outside there was one table occupied which was by the restaurant staff. Management need to retrain their hostness to focus on customers and not what is on the big screen. There are better restaurants nearby for food and watching the game.

data.title: Great meal!
data.text: My husband and I sat at the bar because that is where you usually get the best service at Buffalo Wild Wings.  The bartender was attentive and the wings were HOT and the beer was COLD.  The Caesar salad I also ordered was just large enough.  Great food and service.

data.title: Happy Hour starts at 2pm
data.text: This facility focused on the customer experience well being a chain.   Happy hour does start at 2pm  right after lunch rush.   While visiting Norfolk for a hockey game-- caught at late lunch and were treated like we were the only guests in the restaurant.  Fun with sports on every TV --

data.title: best wings in town!
data.text: Okay, so I have ate quite a few wings in my day and from all different parts of the country. Surprisingly the wings here are amazing, so surprised for a chain restaurant...but when wings are in your name they better be good...Yes, Buffalo Wild wings you did love up to your name!
